decision_conditions: Notwithstanding the information shown on the submitted drawings, details of vehicular access, including off-site works, new vehicular and pedestrian accesses, traffic control/management system, and programme for implementation shall be maintained in accordance with the details submitted through ref. P/2008/2529.  Such details as approved shall be implemented in accordance with the approved programme and thereafter permanently retained.

REASON: In the interests of highway safety, and to protect living conditions of occupiers in the surrounding area and the character and appearance of the surrounding area, in accordance with policies T1 and T3 of the London Plan (2021).
| The development shall be maintained in accordance with the details of materials associated with ref. P/2007/1131.
REASON: To ensure that the materials harmonise with the surroundings, in accordance with policy 7.4 of the adopted Ealing DPD (2013).
| The drainage scheme as approved through ref. P/2007/1127 shall be maintained in accordance with the details submitted.
REASON: To ensure that adequate drainage of the site is carried out as approved, in accordance with policy SI13 of the adopted London Plan (2021).
| The detailed tree survey and method statement submitted through ref. P/2007/1128 shall be maintained in accordance with the approved details.
REASON:  To prevent damage to the trees and in the interest of the visual character and appearance of the area, in accordance with policy G7 of the adopted London Plan (2021).

| The existing trees on the site shall not be lopped, felled or otherwise affected in any way (including raising or lowering soil levels under the crown spread of the trees) and no excavation shall be cut under the crown spread of the trees without the prior written permission of the Local Planning Authority.  Any trees to be lopped or felled shall be replaced to the satisfaction of the Local Planning Authority.
REASON: To safeguard the trees in the interest of visual character and appearance of the area, in accordance with policy G7 of the adopted London Plan (2021).
| The development shall be maintained in accordance with the details of both hard and soft landscaping works, including a phased programme of works, submitted through ref. P/2007/1129.
REASON: To ensure that the development is landscaped in the interests of the visual character and appearance of the area, in accordance with policy G5 of the adopted London Plan (2021).

| The development shall take place in accordance with the details associated with ref. P/2007/1130, stating the positions, design, materials and type of boundary treatment erected. Development shall be carried out in accordance with the approved details and thereafter permanently retained.
REASON: To protect the amenity of the area, in accordance with policy 7.4 of the adopted Ealing DPD (2013).
| Landscape maintenance shall be carried out in accordance with the approved schedule, and details submitted through ref. P/2007/1126.
REASON:  To protect the landscaping in the interests of the visual character and appearance of the area, in accordance with policy G5 of the adopted London Plan (2021).
| Details demonstrating that the recommendations of the Institution of Lighting Engineers and Guidance Notes For The Reduction Of Light Pollution shall be maintained in accordance ref. P/2007/1352.
REASON: To protect the living conditions of occupiers in surrounding area in accordance with policy 7B of the adopted Ealing DPD (2013).

| Details of all external lighting erected, demonstrating compliance with the recommendations of the Institution of Lighting Engineers 'Guidance Notes for the Reduction of Light Pollution' and the provisions of BS 5489 Part 9, must be maintained in accordance with the details approved through ref. P/2007/1350.
REASON: To protect the living conditions of occupiers of the properties surrounding the site in accordance with policy 7B of the adopted Ealing DPD (2013).
| The retail element of the development hereby approved shall operate only between the hours of 8.00am - 22.00pm Monday to Saturday, and 10.00am - 5.00pm Sundays and Public Holidays.
REASON: To protect residential amenity, in accordance with policy 7B of the adopted Ealing DPD (2013).
| There shall be no delivery and the loading or unloading of goods outside the hours of:
o	07:00-23:00 Monday to Saturday
REASON: To protect residential amenity, in accordance with policy 7B of the adopted Ealing DPD (2013).

| Any machinery or equipment that is fixed to the building structure should be fixed with suitable anti-vibration isolators and satisfy an acoustic standard of not exceeding NR25 (Leq 5mins) inside a habitable room - details to be approved by the Local Planning Authority prior to the commencement of the development and such details as are approved shall be implemented prior to first occupation and retained permanently thereafter.
REASON: To protect residential amenity, in accordance with policy 7B of the adopted Ealing DPD (2013).

| 10% of the scheme's residential units shall comply with the Council's adopted Supplementary Planning Guidance with regard to wheelchair manoeuvering, door openings, kitchen space and access to communal terrace. Details shall be permanently maintained in accordance with the details submitted through ref. P/2007/1134.
REASON: To provide for a reasonable level of disabled access, in accordance with policy D6 of the adopted London Plan (2021).

| Details of a refuse storage and waste management programme, including specification and location of the proposed waste compactor, shall be maintained in accordance with the details submitted through ref. P/2007/1136.
REASON:  To ensure adequate refuse storage and to protect the living conditions of occupiers of the area, in accordance with policies SI8 of the adopted London Plan (2021).

| Details of the design of the building and car/cycle and parking area, hard and soft landscaping and bin storage areas to comply with the aims and objectives of Secured By Design and Secured Car Parks award shall be maintained in accordance with the details submitted through ref. P/2008/2527. The approved details shall be permanently retained.
REASON: In the interest of the safety of the occupiers and visitors to the premises, in accordance with policies 7B of the adopted Ealing DPD (2013).

| The approved variation to Condition 12, specifying delivery times, shall be retained for a period of 1 year from this permission, at which point the applicant shall reapply for the permanent inclusion of the change in delivery times, subject to an assessment and written approval by the Local Authority.

Reason: The extension of delivery hours is such that the Local Planning Authority is only prepared to grant permission for a limited period to ensure the success of the change and minimal impact on adjoining residents. The limitation of the consent period ensures compliance with policy D6 of the London Plan (2021) and section 57(2) of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990 (as amended).
| No vehicle engines or refrigeration units shall be left running while vehicles used in conjunction with the development are stationary at the site.

Reason: To ensure that the amenity of occupiers of the development site/ surrounding premises is not adversely affected by noise or fumes, in accordance with policy 7B of the adopted Ealing DPD (2013).
| Permitted number of deliveries shall be limited to 3 per day.

Reason: To ensure that the amenity of occupiers of the development site/ surrounding premises is not adversely affected by noise or fumes, in accordance with policy 7B of the adopted Ealing DPD (2013).

| Deliveries to the store shall occur only in the partially enclosed delivery bay, with the dock leading directly from the rear of the trailer into the store and without the use of forklift trucks or other noise sources which could cause tonal or impulsive noise impacts or fall above the LOAEL, as described in the NPPG and NPPF, at noise sensitive sources. Delivery noise shall also not exceed the existing background noise at noise sensitive sources, as assessed according to BS4142:2014 +A1 2019.

Reason: To ensure that the amenity of occupiers of the development site/ surrounding premises is not adversely affected by noise or fumes, in accordance with policy 7B of the adopted Ealing DPD (2013).
description: Minor Material Amendment  (S.73) to vary condition 13 to extend delivery hours pursuant to planning permission P/2000/3248 dated 11/09/2006 for 'Redevelopment of site by erection of 5 storey building comprising 1402 m2 of A1 gross floorspace (Lidl supermarket) and 76 residential flats (6012m2 gross floorspace), of which 24 will be for affordable housing (32%), together with associated car parking'
